Articles.Content: I did what I usually do to takeoff put the throttle to full and fired up my engine but I heard a sizzle noise instead and nothing happened I am on a 32 bit windows 10 aspire e 15 start with intel Celeron processor N2840 intel HD graphics 4 gb DDR3 l memory and 500 gb HDD
Not sure what's wrong, but that cpu is quite low spec to be playing 3d physics based games.
Hi @buildmad22, pleas take a look at this thread, thank you :)

@sal_vager screenshot is not needed because it happens with every liquid fuel engine and I don't know how to get into my installation folder @JTpopcornit runs at a solid 40-50 FPS if my camera is pointing away from the ground

Edited March 5, 2016 by buildmad22
spelt runs funs

@buildmad22, this is not normal so as much information as possible is needed, including screenshots.

We need to know whether you use the Store, Steam or other install, we can't help without more info, sorry.

Why do people always assume the worst every time and start asking for output logs? It's probably just a simple fuel flow or intake air issue. Make sure you actually have fuel and air and that it can reach the engine. Right click the engine and check what it's deprived of.

Screenshots would be helpful.

We need info, it's as simple as that, we currently don't know:

What engines are affected (rocket, jet, etc).

What fuels are in the vessel.

Whether the tanks are full.

Whether intakes are present and open.

Where the decouplers are and their fuel crossfeed state.

Whether mods are in use (yes, even though this is unmodded support, people post modded issues here).

Etcetera.

All we know so far is that liquid engines are not working, as liquid engines should be working we need more info to find out why.
I thought it not working on planes was normal my game isn't modded liquid fuel is is the rocket and they are full and I'm just about to get more info
Make sure you have oxidizer as well as liquid fuel for rocket engines.

engine status: flameout

reason: oxidiser deprived

this has never happened and I'm using my normal orbit setup

Edited March 5, 2016 by buildmad22
@buildmad22, no, not working on planes isn't normal.
I fixed it the fuel tank I was using only had fuel and no oxidiser
